title: Teachers Against Politicizing the Classroom
sub_head: Virginia Democrats twist education policy, making even liberals uncomfortable.
body:
Regarding “A Brawl Over Schools In Virginia” (Review & Outlook, Oct. 1): The votes of teachers as well as parents may be in play over these issues in schools. Under the current Democratic administration, the Virginia Department of Education has done much to politicize education.
In the spring, there was a flap over proposed changes in the sequence of mathematics courses, with critics accusing the department of eliminating accelerated course options before seventh grade in the name of equity. Social-studies standards have been modified to reflect a very left-leaning interpretation of the narrative surrounding race in American history.
